reviews.review_msg: He has a good sense of humour and teaches with effort. However, he's too strict on hiragana and katakana writings.
He is so funny and nice =)
He is really nice to everyone unless you talk when he is talking. Quizzes are pretty easy and straight forward. But you must DO WORK regularly.

Awesome lecturer! He makes Japanese easy to understand and very enjoyable to learn. He only teaches at SFU campus though. I would definitely recommend students go take JAPN at Surrey just to be in his class.
very nice and friendly prof if you go to class and try to do the homework, you will at less get a B
You will fall in love with him ;)
Very good instructor.  Plus, he's very outgoing and even makes time to make social gatherings for us so we can get to have fun with our Japanese skills.  Hope he teaches JAPN 200 in the fall!

Very easy-going. Very lenient to students. I suggest taking this course with a friend. One of the oral tests require you to practice with a partner. Getting an A+ is actually possible in this course!!! But really, Shinno Sensei is a great teacher. Although I'm a little disappointed that there is too little to learn in this course.

Shinno is a super good instructor!! He is truly passionate in his job and cares about his students acedemics in his course. Overall, he is not a tough teacher at all. He says that you are not allowed to make up a quiz if you are late, but in the end, he still allows you to make up it. Easy & FUN! =)

Shinno sensee is a hard marker on writing (hiragana, katakana..etc) but he's a good explainer, and cares about the students. He's also very funny! Great guy! THe course itself is good too! Highly recommended if you have an interest in Japn language.
Bad marker! extremely unfair....marks docked off out of nowhere...and more of a teasing than teaching tone...bad bad bad  (but the course itself was pretty interesting and not very hard)
Very good ~!!! Teaching is clear and tests are fair. Have many interesting stories to share with the class~
Truly cares about what he teaches and how his student progress from his teaching. He made me feel like his main goal is to help students learn, NOT to grade them. Funny and kind
